dori Niemann  Staff WriterMarch  

While some students took a traditional Spring Break trip to enjoy themselves some turned to Alternative Spring Break to meet the needs of others PERIOD



Adults view college students as selfish but not the ones I know said Roy Lanham of the Newman Catholic Center PERIOD

Lanham is a part of the Student Volunteer Center which is part of the Newman Center that heads ASB PERIOD

ASB is a program that provides Eastern students with the opportunity to have an enjoyable break and help others in the process PERIOD Lanham said the organization prides itself as one of the best ASBs in the Midwest and he said ASB programs are growing in popularity and are offered at most any university these days PERIOD

ASB also gives students the chance to get involved with handson services education faithbased reflection and cultural experiences PERIOD

Krystal Hering a senior English major was a part of the committee for ASB and said she was pleased with how quickly the Mexico sites filled up PERIOD

Hering has been to Mexico Philadelphia and New York through ASB PERIOD During her first trip to Philadelphia she said her favorite part was working with the people PERIOD

I enjoyed talking with people she said PERIOD A lot of them were making strides to get off the streets and thats great. aSB first started in  as a small idea from a group of college students who wanted to make a difference and it has grown in the past  years to what it is now which was more than what anyone thought PERIOD

During the first year of ASB there were  students and only three places to go PERIOD Now it has gotten as big as  places to go or sites and  students in recent years PERIOD

Lanham said he was pleased with his  sites and  students this year PERIOD Expectations for next year are already making marks in his mind PERIOD He said he hopes to have at least  sites next spring PERIOD

ASB has offered the chance to go outside the United States since  with trips to Mexico PERIOD This year some of sites within the United States included New York Georgia Alabama Tennessee Louisiana and Kentucky PERIOD During the trips some students worked in soup kitchens and others with children PERIOD

ASBs a good opportunity to get a different perspective on other cultures and to see poverty on another level said Jeremy Daily a junior biology major PERIOD

Daily was in San Miguel Mexico working with children in a day care PERIOD

Marissa Jernegan a junior biology major went to Atlanta and took part in the Project Open Hand which is a group of people who prepare and deliver meals to those who suffer from AIDS PERIOD

It was sad to see people who couldnt help themselves but it was good to know that we could help them she said PERIOD

Jernegan also said this project accommodates a multitude of different diets for different people such as those with diabetes. besides the Student Volunteer Center the Wesley Foundation started its own ASB. chris Agans a junior communications major who has taken part in the trips the past two years said the program is two years old PERIOD

You leave having the satisfaction of knowing you helped other people and you didnt just take the time out for yourself he said PERIOD

The Wesley Foundation had  participants this year and went to Albany Ga. where they all helped with Habitat for Humanity PERIOD
